intro: Ateleia venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan ateleia, is a tropical shrub native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
